page.title: 11Nidderdale show: Pateley.
page.content: Every year in September,the Nidderdale Agricultural Show is held in Bewerley Park. The committee of the Nidderdale Agricultural Society organises it and competitors come from all over York- shire and even further. Some families make it part of their annual holiday. A few classes are for local entrants only, who must live within a nine mile radius from Pateley Bridge. Most of the dale's farmers are subscribers to the show. They can give from Â£3.00 to Â£20.00 and, therefore, do not pay an entrance fee on the day of the show. Entry fees for the public are Â£1.50 for adults and 75p for children. There are many different competitions such as: dog-trials, show-jumping, rabbits, poultry and produce. Marquees are put up during the weekend of the show. On the day of the show the park is full of people, stalls and animals.
